channel.title: Golang Weekly
channel.description: A weekly newsletter about the Go programming language

item.title: „ÄêGo's work on native FIPS 140 support„ÄëGOÂú®Êú¨Âú∞FIPS 140ÊîØÊåÅÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑÂ∑•‰Ωú
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã562 ‚Äî July 16, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

üîí¬†The FIPS 140-3 Go Cryptographic Module ‚Äî FIPS 140 is a standard for cryptography implementations that‚Äôs a requirement in certain subsectors (particularly involving the US government) and while most developers won‚Äôt need to worry about it, FIPS 140 support will open doors for some Go devs. This post goes into depth about Go's FIPS 140 support, but if you don‚Äôt know what FIPS 140 is, don‚Äôt worry about it too¬†much.

Valsorda, McCarney and Shoemaker

Fix Slow Postgres Queries with pganalyze Query Advisor ‚Äî Register for our webinar July 30 to learn how to detect common Postgres query plan problems, get actionable rewrite recommendations, and track the impact in one comprehensive¬†tool.

pganalyze sponsor

A Deep Dive Into Deeply Recursive Go ‚Äî Go‚Äôs lack of tail-call optimization makes deep recursion prone to fatal stack overflows. Juho discusses real-world recursion scenarios (and the CVEs they led to) and offers ways to make things safer in your code, along with a proposal to add recoverable overflow handling in the¬†runtime.

Juho Fors√©n (Mattermost)

Learn Go with Tests: An Online Book for Learning TDD with Go ‚Äî It‚Äôs had a few updates over the past year and remains a fantastic resource for walking through both the basics and more intermediate topics like reflection and¬†generics.

Chris James

üá´üá∑ There's now also a French translation, if that's more your tasse de th√©.

You Don't Need testify/assert ‚Äî An alternative approach for tight, clean tests, which leads to Anton‚Äôs Be minimal test assertions package that follows his own¬†advice.

Anton Zhiyanov

Kubernetes Best Practices 2025: Comprehensive White Paper ‚Äî Learn how to improve Kubernetes security, reliability and cost control with practical guidance from real-world¬†clusters.

Fairwinds sponsor

üìÑ Doing Web Things with CGIs is Mostly No Longer a Good Idea ‚Äì A sensible response to a fun post we featured last week about using Go to create modern-day CGI-style¬†apps. Chris Siebenmann

üìÑ Building Event-Driven Go Apps with Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions Abhishek Gupta (Microsoft)

üìÑ A Zero-Sized Bug Hunt in golang.org/x/sync Fillmore Labs

üìÑ New in Go 1.25: WaitGroup.Go() Christoph Berger

üõ† Code & Tools

pproftui: A Terminal-Based Diagnostic Tool for pprof Data ‚Äî The idea is rather than focusing on profiling data visually, you get a quick view into the actual code causing the activities being¬†monitored. You can then fix problems more quickly and diff the results of future runs. Live profile viewing is also¬†possible.

Oloruntobi1

oapi-codegen 2.5: Generate Go Boilerplate from OpenAPI 3 Specs ‚Äî A tool and library for converting OpenAI specifications to Go code, both server and client-side. Less boilerplate for you to write! The v2.5 release notes tease some new tweaks and eventual OpenAPI 3.1 support (which you can use some tricks to achieve for¬†now).

Various Contributors

Introducing go-cdc-chunkers: A New Way to Chunk and Deduplicate Everything ‚Äî Content-Defined Chunking (CDC) is the idea of dividing data into variable-sized chunks based on the content of the data, making it easier to deduplicate. Gilles explains why that‚Äôs useful (in quite some depth) and shows off a new Go project giving access to such¬†algorithms.

Gilles Chehade

cpuid 2.3: CPU Feature Identification for Go ‚Äî Use this to find out how many physical and logical cores there are, the family of CPU, and similar details. Supports x86/x64 and¬†ARM64.

Klaus Post

  • FastHTTP 1.64 ‚Äì Performance-oriented alternative to net/http for specific high-volume¬†scenarios.

  • Revive 1.11 ‚Äì Fast, configurable, extensible, flexible linter for¬†Go.

  • FerretDB 2.4 ‚Äì MongoDB-a-like but atop Postgres (or¬†SQLite).

  • gocryptfs 2.6 ‚Äì Encrypted overlay¬†filesystem atop¬†Go-FUSE.

  • BadgerDB 4.8 ‚Äì Fast Go-powered key/value¬†database.

  • Kubo 0.36 ‚Äì An IPFS implementation in Go

„Äë

Gilles Chehade

item.title: „ÄêSwiss Tables are a big plus„ÄëÁëûÂ£´Ê°åÂ≠êÂæàÂ§ß
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã563 ‚Äî July 23, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

How Go 1.24's Swiss Tables 'Saved Us Hundreds of Gigabytes' ‚Äî A look at how the new ‚ÄòSwiss Tables‚Äô implementation in Go 1.24 helped reduce memory usage in a large in-memory map, how the change was profiled and sized, and a peek at how struct-level optimizations led to even larger fleet-wide¬†savings.

Nayef Ghattas (Datadog)

üí° This post is a strong follow-up to another post: How we tracked down a Go 1.24 memory regression across hundreds of¬†pods.

Add Enterprise Features, Keep Your Velocity ‚Äî Single sign-on, user provisioning, and role management take time to get right. WorkOS provides clean APIs and reliable infrastructure so your team can stay focused on what makes your product stand out. Trusted by OpenAI, Sourcegraph, and¬†Temporal.

WorkOS sponsor

Go at American Express Today: Seven Key Learnings ‚Äî It‚Äôs always great to read the lessons learned about technology adoption, especially at larger companies. Amex is thriving with Go today (with over 1,000 gophers on staff), but the road wasn‚Äôt always¬†smooth.

Benjamin Cane (American Express)

Logging in Go with Slog: A Practitioner's Guide ‚Äî log/slog was introduced in Go 1.21 as the go-to structured log package, and it has many features, many of which are touched on in this comprehensive¬†tutorial.

Ayooluwa Isiah (Dash0)

IN BRIEF:

  • üá∫üá∏ GopherCon 2025 takes place this August 26-28 in New York City with a great lineup of talks with standard tickets available till next¬†Tuesday.

  • The tree for Go 1.26 is expected to open today, meaning work on Go 1.26 (fixes first, new features later) can begin in earnest on GitHub.

  • Gofakeit is a Go package for generating random/fake data in hundreds of categories and its author has written about its history and how it's reached 5k stars on GitHub.

  • Google has built a new open-source secrets / credentials scanner in Go called Veles.

Integration Testing for Go Apps using Testcontainers and Containerized Databases ‚Äî Want to test your app against real dependencies without the complexities of managing them (or, worse, running on production services)? Testcontainers provide a way to spin up real services that exist only for the duration of your¬†tests.

Abhishek Gupta (Microsoft)

üìÑ Tracing Go Apps Using Runtime Tracing and OpenTelemetry Preeti Dewani (Last9)

üìÑ Designing a Composable Rate Limiter clipperhouse

üì∫ TinyGo Code Review of a GSM/GPRS Driver Pat Whitti

üõ† Code & Tools

PocketBase: A Go-Powered Backend in One Binary ‚Äî An open source backend app including an embedded SQLite database with realtime subscription support, file and user management, an admin/dashboard UI, and REST API ‚Äì its main target is for use as a backend to JavaScript frontend apps. Live demo, GitHub repo and nice¬†docs.

Gani Georgiev

Redka: Redis Re-Implemented with SQL ‚Äî A Go-powered data store that‚Äôs compatible with Redis‚Äôs API but uses SQL behind the scenes to make it all work. Till now it‚Äôs been based on SQLite but v0.6 introduces Postgres¬†support.

Anton Zhiyanov

How to Use Go Tooling + Depot‚Äôs API to Outsource Container Builds ‚Äî Stop managing container orchestration complexity. Learn how to use Depot to build untrusted images quickly and¬†securely.

Depot sponsor

go-quartz 0.15: Simple, Zero-Dependency Scheduling Library ‚Äî Inspired by the Quartz scheduler for Java, go-quartz makes it easy to spin up a scheduler within a Go process and trigger functions and jobs on defined¬†schedules.

Eugene R.

  • oauth2-proxy 7.10 ‚Äì Reverse proxy or middleware for providing OAuth¬†authentication.

  • GitHub MCP Server 0.8 ‚Äì Yes, GitHub's official MCP server is written in¬†Go.

  • Memos 0.25 ‚Äì Self-hosted knowledge management and note taking¬†app.

  • BillionMail 4 ‚Äì Go-powered email campaign¬†platform.

  • rqlite 8.40 ‚Äì SQLite-backed distributed database.

  • golangci-lint 2.3 ‚Äì A faster way to run Go¬†linters.

  • quic-go 0.54 ‚Äì Pure Go QUIC¬†implementation.

  • fx 38.0 ‚Äì The powerful terminal JSON¬†viewer.

üïπÔ∏è A Blast from the Past..

Gopher2600: An Atari VCS Emulator ‚Äî A mostly feature-complete emulator that includes controller support, gameplay recording, and CRT display effects. We‚Äôve linked to it a few times over the years, and amazingly it‚Äôs still getting significant updates, like in yesterday‚Äôs v0.50.0¬†release.

Stephen Illingworth

„Äë

gani georgiev

- ‰∏éRedisÁöÑAPIÂÖºÂÆπÁöÑGoÈ©±Âä®Êï∞ÊçÆÂ≠òÂÇ®Ôºå‰ΩÜÂú®ÂπïÂêé‰ΩøÁî®SQLÊù•‰ΩøÂÖ∂‰∏ÄÂàáÊ≠£Â∏∏„ÄÇÂà∞ÁõÆÂâç‰∏∫Ê≠¢ÔºåÂÆÉ‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âü∫‰∫ésqliteÔºå‰ΩÜ v0.6 ÂºïÂÖ•Postgres Support„ÄÇ

Anton Zhiyanov

- ÂÅúÊ≠¢ÁÆ°ÁêÜÈõÜË£ÖÁÆ±ÁºñÊéíÂ§çÊùÇÊÄß„ÄÇ‰∫ÜËß£Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî®‰ªìÂ∫ìÂø´ÈÄüÂÆâÂÖ®Âú∞ÊûÑÂª∫‰∏ç‰ø°‰ªªÁöÑÂõæÂÉè„ÄÇ

- Âèó quartz Scheduler in Style of Spin and Spin and spine a proce and a Process and Aptim a postion an a proce and a spine a proce and a proce and a interÂú®ÂÆö‰πâÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥Ë°®„ÄÇ

Eugene R.

item.title: „Äê200 million requests per day with Go and cgi-bin„ÄëGOÂíåCGI-binÊØèÂ§©2‰∫øË¶ÅÊ±Ç
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã561 ‚Äî July 9, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

What's //go:nosplit For? ‚Äî Go has many comment-based directives for tweaking inlining, stack checks, write barriers, and more. Many aren‚Äôt well documented, but can have striking effects, such as nosplit which can offer a performance boost in certain scenarios, but may also lead to faults or a locked runtime. This is, nonetheless, a fantastic¬†explainer.

Miguel Young

Generic Interfaces ‚Äî Axel presents the idea that as interfaces are types themselves, they too can have type parameters. He shows how this lets you write one core implementation of a binary search tree and support built-in, callback-based, or method-based comparisons, before moving on to deeper concepts. There's a lot to get your teeth into¬†here.

Axel Wagner

Build Containers from Scratch ‚Äî Start with raw Linux tools like chroot, namespaces, and cgroups to truly understand how containers work. Then build your own with Docker and deploy them using¬†Kubernetes.

Frontend Masters sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • ‚≠ê Go 1.25 Release Candidate 2 has been¬†released.

  • Socket's Sarah Gooding fleshes out the recent story that there's an official Go SDK for MCP (Model Context Protocol) under development.

  • From Go 1.25 onward, Microsoft's build of Go will have telemetry enabled by¬†default.

  • ü§ñ Imagine a filesystem that's really just an LLM making stuff up: Andrew Healey's implemented this spine-chilling idea in Go as a mountable FUSE filesystem.

  • GitLab has caught a supply chain attack targeting Go developers through a fake MongoDB driver¬†module.

Serving 200 Million Requests Per Day with cgi-bin ‚Äî CGI was commonly used in the earlier days of the Web to have HTTP requests launch backend processes and return the results. Over time we moved onto persistently-running apps, but could the speed of Go and launching processes in 2025 make cgi-bin viable again? Yes! (But you might not want¬†to..)

Jake Gold

‚ñ∂Ô∏è How I Recreated Shazam's Algorithm from Scratch ‚Äì A fun look at implementing a music detection algorithm from scratch. Go does the heavy lifting and there‚Äôs¬†source. Chigozirim

üìÑ An Optimization and Debugging Story with Go and DTrace Philippe Gaultier

üìÑ Developing a Terminal UI in Go with Bubble Tea ‚Äì Good high level¬†advice. Alex Pliutau

üìÑ Am I Online? ‚Äì An interesting way to see if your app is truly online by checking a special Google¬†URL. Anton Zhiyanov

üõ† Code & Tools

doWM: A Tiling and Floating Window Manager for X11 ‚Äî A fast, lightweight window manager written entirely in Go. You‚Äôll need to be proficient with Linux, however, but this could be a great gateway into tweaking something that feels right for you. GitHub¬†repo.

BobdaProgrammer

üïπÔ∏è¬†GORE: A Pure Go Minimal 'Doom' Implementation ‚Äî A few months ago we linked to doomgeneric, an initial effort to transpile 1993‚Äôs Doom to Go. This cleans it up a lot, makes it more ‚ÄúGo-ish‚Äù and platform agnostic, and.. it can even render the game on the¬†terminal!

Andre Renaud

Effortless Go Contract Testing: Inferred Automatically From¬†Traffic ‚Äî Stop hand-crafting brittle contracts. See how they can be inferred from real traffic and updated as your Go APIs¬†evolve.

Signadot sponsor

go-ytdlp: yt-dlp CLI Bindings for Go ‚Äî yt-dlp is a popular audio/video downloading tool ‚Äì not just for YouTube but hundreds of¬†platforms.

Liam Stanley

Minimock: A Tool to Generate Mocks from Interface Declarations ‚Äî Generates statically typed mocks and helpers, is fully integrated with the testing package, and supports¬†generics.

Juno Inc.

Lox: A Lexer and Parser Generator for Go ‚Äî Inspired by ANTLR at the surface level (combined parser and lexer, action code separated from grammar) but more similar to yacc internally (LR(1), dependency-free¬†parser).

dcaiafa

  • ü§ñ Mods 1.8 ‚Äì Charm's pipelineable AI CLI client, now with MCP¬†support.

  • Hugo 0.148 ‚Äì The popular Go-powered static site generator. Beware of some breaking¬†changes.

  • MCP-Go 0.33 ‚Äì An implementation of the Model Context Protocol¬†(MCP).

  • OpenFGA 1.9 ‚Äì Google Zanzibar-inspired authorization¬†engine.

  • GoReleaser 2.11 ‚Äì Build/release binaries for multiple¬†platforms.

  • pgroll 0.14 ‚Äì Zero-downtime, reversible, schema¬†migrations.

  • sh 3.12 ‚Äì Shell script parser, formatter, and¬†interpreter.

  • fzf 0.64 ‚Äì Popular command-line fuzzy¬†finder.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

CGI was commonly used in the earlier days of the Web to have HTTP requests launch backend processes and return the results.ÈöèÁùÄÊó∂Èó¥ÁöÑÊµÅÈÄùÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËΩ¨Âà∞‰∫ÜÊåÅÁª≠ËøêË°åÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØ2025Âπ¥GOÂíåÂêØÂä®ÊµÅÁ®ãÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶ÊòØÂê¶ÂèØ‰ª•‰Ωø cgi-bin ÂÜçÊ¨°ÂèØË°åÔºüÊòØÁöÑÔºÅ Ôºà‰ΩÜÊòØÊÇ®ÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÊÉ≥..Ôºâ

Êù∞ÂÖã¬∑Èáë

‚ñ∂q üìÑüìÑ Alex pliutau

üìÑ Anton Zhiyanov

1.48em;> 1.48em;

ÁöÑÂπ≥Èì∫ÂíåÊµÆÂä®Á™óÂè£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô® - ÂÆåÂÖ®ÂÜôÂú®GO‰∏≠ÁöÑÂø´ÈÄüÔºåËΩªÂ∑ßÁöÑÁ™óÂè£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô®„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÊÇ®ÈúÄË¶ÅÁ≤æÈÄöLinuxÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÂèØËÉΩÊòØË∞ÉÊï¥ÈÄÇÂêàÊÇ®ÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÁöÑÁªù‰Ω≥Èó®Êà∑„ÄÇ github repo„ÄÇ

BobDaprogrammer

- Âá†‰∏™ÊúàÂâçÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÈìæÊé•Âà∞ doomgeneric ÊúÄÂàùÁöÑÂä™ÂäõÔºåto transpile 1993 doomm dooms to to tom dooms to to to to tom dooms„ÄÇËøôÊ†∑ÂèØ‰ª•Ê∏ÖÁêÜÂ§ßÈáèÔºå‰ΩøÂÖ∂Êõ¥Âä†‚Äú go-ish‚ÄùÂíåÂπ≥Âè∞‰∏çÂèØÁü•ËÆ∫ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÂÆÉÁîöËá≥ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ÁªàÁ´Ø‰∏äÊ∏≤ÊüìÊ∏∏ÊàèÔºÅ

Andre Renaud

- ÂÅúÊ≠¢ÊâãÂ∑•Âà∂‰ΩúËÑÜÂº±ÂêàÂêå„ÄÇÊü•ÁúãÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰ªéÂÆûÈôÖÊµÅÈáè‰∏≠Êé®Êñ≠Âá∫ÂÆÉ‰ª¨Âπ∂ÈöèÁùÄGO APIÁöÑÂèëÂ±ïËÄåÊõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÇ

Mignadot <Ë∑®Â∫¶Ê†∑Âºè=‚Äú text-transformÔºöuppercase; margin-leftÔºö4px; font-sizeÔºö0.9em;È¢úËâ≤ÔºöÔºÉ885ÔºÅ

yt-dlp CLI Bindings for Go ‚Äî yt-dlp is a popular audio/video downloading tool ‚Äì not just for YouTube but Êï∞Áôæ‰∏™Âπ≥Âè∞„ÄÇ

Âà©‰∫öÂßÜ¬∑ÊñØÂù¶Âà©

item.title: „ÄêRaces and memory leaks„ÄëÁßçÊóèÂíåËÆ∞ÂøÜÊ≥ÑÊºè
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã564 ‚Äî July 30, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Hunting a Memory Leak ‚Äî Go has a fantastic runtime and garbage collection but that doesn't mean Go apps are immune to memory leaks. Jason, of the DoltHub team, shares the tale of diagnosing a customer-reported memory leak ultimately caused by improperly closed¬†files.

Jason Fulghum (Dolt)

Go Features by Version (or What's in Which Go) ‚Äî A list of features and the versions in which they first appeared, all the way up to next month‚Äôs expected release of Go¬†1.25.

Anton Zhiyanov

Kubernetes Cluster Management in 100MB of RAM ‚Äî Portainer is written in Go for speed and efficiency. Manage 200+ Kubernetes clusters from a single control plane using just 100MB of RAM. No bloat, no nonsense; just fast, lightweight cluster management, the Go¬†way.

Portainer‚Ä§io sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • üá¨üáß GopherCon UK 2025 is taking place in London this August 13-15 for its eleventh¬†run. You can see the jam-packed schedule¬†here.

  • üìä The Stack Overflow 2025 Survey results are out with Go getting some pretty good representation as one of the most admired languages and languages developers aspire to¬†use.

  • As of right now, there's only one 'release blocker' issue for Go 1.25. Final release still expected in¬†August.

Go's Race Detector Has a Mutex Blind Spot ‚Äî A ‚Äòdata race‚Äô happens when two goroutines concurrently access a shared variable without synchronization and at least one access writes to it. Go‚Äôs race detector helps spot these, but it‚Äôs not perfect and it‚Äôs worth knowing where false negatives can¬†occur.

Double Free Dev

New from Depot: Claude Code Sessions ‚Äî Create, resume, and maintain Claude Code sessions across your entire organization with¬†Depot.

Depot sponsor

üìÑ Parsing Protobuf Like Never Before ‚Äì Some interesting general Go performance details and a look at Buf‚Äôs super fast hyperpb Protobuf¬†parser. Miguel Young de la Sota

üìÑ Interprocedural Analysis: Catch nil Dereferences Before They Crash Your Code ‚Äì A new feature coming to JetBrains' forthcoming GoLand 2025.2¬†release. Arseniy Terekhov (JetBrains)

üìÑ There is No Memory Safety Without Thread Safety Ralf J

üìÑ Implementing Merkle Trees in Go Yoray / Vaktibabat

üõ† Code & Tools

OV: Feature-Rich Terminal Text Viewer/Pager ‚Äî Aims to replace less, tail -f and watch in one. GitHub¬†repo.

Noboru Saito

go-minimp3 1.0: Go Bindings for minimp3 ‚Äî minimp3 is a minimal C library for decoding MP3¬†files.

Cowork AI

Pal: A New, Opinionated Dependency Injection Framework ‚Äî ‚ÄúPal inherits some design decisions from fx and do and tries to offer the most nondisruptive IoC experience ‚Ä¶‚Äù

Gleb Sinyavskiy

hyperpb: 10x Faster Dynamic Protobuf Parsing ‚Äî A fully-dynamic Protobuf parser that boasts being 10x faster than dynamicpb, the standard Go solution for dynamic¬†Protobuf.

Buf

  • Dbmate 2.28 ‚Äì Framework-agnostic, Go-powered database migration¬†tool for MySQL, Postgres, SQLite, and¬†ClickHouse.

  • ü§ñ MCP-Go 0.36 ‚Äì An implementation of the Model Context Protocol¬†(MCP).

  • GoCV 0.42 ‚Äì Bindings for the OpenCV computer vision¬†library.

  • jwt-go v5.3 ‚Äì Library to create and verify JSON Web Tokens.

  • Bob v0.39 ‚Äì SQL query builder and ORM/Factory generator.

  • NATS.go 1.44 ‚Äì Go client for the NATS messaging¬†system.

  • ü§ñ Eino 0.4 ‚Äì LLM/AI app dev framework for Go.

  • go-github 74.0 ‚Äì GitHub v3 API client¬†library.

  • Traefik 3.5 ‚Äì Popular cloud native app¬†proxy.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Calling all Go devs! We want to learn about the tools you use and features you love. Help us by filling out our survey. You may win a¬†prize.

Join Sticker Mule's "kick ass" team as a Senior Software Engineer! Our teams operate from 17 countries and we're looking for more exceptional engineers.

üéÅ And one for fun..

ZUSE: A Terminal-Based IRC Client ‚Äî For the benefit of anyone younger than me, IRC (Internet Relay Chat) is a very long standing text-based chat system that had its heyday in the 90s and 00s, but is still alive today. This new Go-based IRC client is made with Bubble Tea and¬†Lipgloss.

Baby Commando

P.S. A quick last minute addition before we hit send.. it seems like Charm is cooking up something new.
